questions.text: A 16-month-old boy is found to weigh 8kg. A WHO growth chart (weight-for-age) is provided below. Plot the growth chart for this child. What is the most appropriate advice based on the plotted graph? (NEET PG 2021)

options.label: C
options.text: Severe malnutrition - refer to nutrition rehabilitation center

options.label: D
options.text: Moderate malnutrition - teach the mother on how to feed

questions.correct_answer: D. Moderate malnutrition - teach the mother on how to feed
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Moderate malnutrition - teach the mother on how to feed

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Moderate malnutrition in children is indicated by a weight-for-age between -2SD and -3SD on the WHO growth chart, necessitating education on proper feeding practices.

questions.text: An unvaccinated 4-year-old child presents with rashes, fever, and Bitot spot. This can be managed appropriately by: (FMGE JAN 2025)

options.label: C
options.text: Measles vaccine and Vitamin A supplementation

questions.correct_answer: A. Isolation and Vitamin A supplementation
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Isolation and Vitamin A supplementation

Explanation:

  • • Explanation:
  • • When a child presents with measles (characterized by rashes, fever, and Bitot spots), the management involves two critical components:
  • • Isolation: Measles is highly contagious, so the child must be isolated to prevent spread to other individuals, especially those who are unvaccinated or immunocompromised. Vitamin A Supplementation: Vitamin A is crucial in managing measles because: It reduces the severity of the disease Decreases complications Helps reduce mortality, especially in children with vitamin A deficiency Supports immune system function during the infection
  • • Isolation: Measles is highly contagious, so the child must be isolated to prevent spread to other individuals, especially those who are unvaccinated or immunocompromised.
  • • Vitamin A Supplementation: Vitamin A is crucial in managing measles because: It reduces the severity of the disease Decreases complications Helps reduce mortality, especially in children with vitamin A deficiency Supports immune system function during the infection
  • • It reduces the severity of the disease Decreases complications Helps reduce mortality, especially in children with vitamin A deficiency Supports immune system function during the infection
  • • It reduces the severity of the disease
  • • Decreases complications
  • • Helps reduce mortality, especially in children with vitamin A deficiency
  • • Supports immune system function during the infection
  • • Other Options:
  • • Other Options:
  • • Option B. Supportive care only: Incorrect. While supportive care is important, it is insufficient. Vitamin A supplementation is a critical intervention in measles management.
  • • Option B. Supportive care only:
  • • Option C. Measles vaccine and Vitamin A supplementation: Incorrect. Once a child has active measles, vaccination is no longer beneficial. The vaccine is preventive, not a treatment for ongoing infection.
  • • Option C. Measles vaccine and Vitamin A supplementation:
  • • Option D. Measles vaccine only: Incorrect. A child with active measles cannot be vaccinated during the acute phase of the illness. Vaccination is ineffective and potentially harmful at this stage.
  • • Option D. Measles vaccine only:

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In active measles infection, isolation and Vitamin A supplementation are the key management strategies, with Vitamin A playing a crucial role in reducing disease severity and complications.

questions.text: In a standard normal distribution, what percentage of data values fall within one standard deviation of the mean? (FMGE JULY 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) 68%

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In a standard normal distribution, 68% of the data values fall within one standard deviation of the mean.

questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Tenofovir

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Drug with dual activity against both HIV and hepatitis B: (Mnemonic: LET)
  • ➤ Drug with dual activity against both HIV and hepatitis B:
  • ➤ (Mnemonic: LET)
  • ➤ Lamivudine Emtricitabine Tenofovir
  • ➤ Lamivudine
  • ➤ Lamivudine

questions.text: Which of the following antidiabetic drugs is preferred in a patient with heart and kidney disease? (FMGE JAN 2025)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) SGLT-2 inhibitors

Explanation:

  • • Explanation:
  • • SGLT-2 inhibitors (drugs ending in -gliflozin like canagliflozin, empagliflozin, dapagliflozin) are the preferred choice because:
  • • They work by inhibiting SGLT-2 in proximal tubules, preventing reabsorption of both glucose and sodium They reduce mortality in patients with congestive heart failure They slow the progression of diabetic kidney disease Their mechanism of promoting glucose and sodium excretion provides cardiovascular and renal benefits beyond glycemic control
  • • They work by inhibiting SGLT-2 in proximal tubules, preventing reabsorption of both glucose and sodium
  • • They reduce mortality in patients with congestive heart failure
  • • They slow the progression of diabetic kidney disease
  • • Their mechanism of promoting glucose and sodium excretion provides cardiovascular and renal benefits beyond glycemic control
  • • Other Options:
  • • Other Options:
  • • Option A. Biguanides (Incorrect)
  • • Option A. Biguanides (Incorrect)
  • • While effective for diabetes, metformin (Biguanides) has limitations in patients with significant kidney disease Must be used cautiously or avoided in patients with renal impairment due to risk of lactic acidosis Does not provide direct cardiovascular benefits like SGLT-2 inhibitors
  • • While effective for diabetes, metformin (Biguanides) has limitations in patients with significant kidney disease
  • • Must be used cautiously or avoided in patients with renal impairment due to risk of lactic acidosis
  • • Does not provide direct cardiovascular benefits like SGLT-2 inhibitors
  • • Option B. GLP-1 analogs (Incorrect)
  • • Option B. GLP-1 analogs (Incorrect)
  • • While they have some cardiovascular benefits, they don't have the same level of evidence for combined cardiac and renal protection as SGLT-2 inhibitors
  • • While they have some cardiovascular benefits, they don't have the same level of evidence for combined cardiac and renal protection as SGLT-2 inhibitors
  • • Option D. Sulfonylureas (Incorrect)
  • • Option D. Sulfonylureas (Incorrect)
  • • Associated with risk of hypoglycemia No proven cardiovascular benefits May need dose adjustment in kidney disease Can cause fluid retention which may worsen heart failure
  • • Associated with risk of hypoglycemia
  • • No proven cardiovascular benefits
  • • May need dose adjustment in kidney disease
  • • Can cause fluid retention which may worsen heart failure

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ SGLT-2 inhibitors are the preferred antidiabetic agents in patients with coexisting heart and kidney disease due to their proven benefits in reducing cardiovascular mortality and slowing the progression of diabetic kidney disease.

questions.text: In the mid-axillary line, the right costo-phrenic recess extends up to the level of which rib? (NEET PG 2015)
questions.explanation:
Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The pleura extends to the 10th rib in the mid-axillary line while the lung ends at the 8th rib, creating a costodiaphragmatic recess between the 8th-10th ribs that is clinically important for thoracentesis procedures.

questions.text: Identify the maternal condition that can lead to the findings in the baby as shown below? (NEET PG 2020)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Pre-gestational diabetes

Explanation:

  • • Explanation
  • • The image shows a condition known as mermaid syndrome or sirenomelia, which is a rare congenital deformity characterized by the fusion of the lower limbs. This condition is characteristically associated with overt (pre-gestational) diabetes mellitus.
  • • Key Points:
  • • Key Points:
  • • Sirenomelia (mermaid syndrome) is strongly linked to maternal pre-gestational diabetes. Overt diabetes mellitus during pregnancy is known to cause various congenital anomalies, with cardiac anomalies being the most common, specifically ventricular septal defects (VSD).
  • • Sirenomelia (mermaid syndrome) is strongly linked to maternal pre-gestational diabetes.
  • • Overt diabetes mellitus during pregnancy is known to cause various congenital anomalies, with cardiac anomalies being the most common, specifically ventricular septal defects (VSD).
  • • Other Options:
  • • Other Options:
  • • Option B. Gestational diabetes mellitus: Gestational diabetes typically occurs later in pregnancy and does not usually cause congenital anomalies, as organogenesis is largely complete by the time gestational diabetes is diagnosed.
  • • Option B. Gestational diabetes mellitus:
  • • Option C. Effect of valproate: Valproate exposure during pregnancy is associated with neural tube defects, facial anomalies (such as cleft lip and palate), and cardiac anomalies, but not sirenomelia.
  • • Option C. Effect of valproate:
  • • Option D. Hypertensive on ACE inhibitors: ACE inhibitors and angiotensin receptor blockers reduce fetal renal perfusion, leading to conditions such as oligohydramnios and subsequent pulmonary hypoplasia, but they do not cause sirenomelia.
  • • Option D. Hypertensive on ACE inhibitors:

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Pre-gestational diabetes is associated with an increased risk of congenital anomalies, including mermaid syndrome (sirenomelia), characterized by the fusion of lower limbs.
  • ➤ Ref: Page 384, Williams Obstetrics 26 th edition
  • ➤ Ref: Page 384, Williams Obstetrics 26 th edition

questions.text: A 29-year-old pregnant woman at 28 weeks of gestation is undergoing routine obstetric evaluation. She has a history of Rh incompatibility, and recent laboratory results show the presence of elevated maternal anti-D antibody titers. The obstetrician is concerned about possible fetal anemia. Which of the following methods is most commonly used to assess fetal anemia in this situation? (FMGE JAN 2025)

options.label: C
options.text: Peak systolic velocity in the fetal middle cerebral artery (MCA)

questions.correct_answer: C. Peak systolic velocity in the fetal middle cerebral artery (MCA)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Peak systolic velocity in the fetal middle cerebral artery (MCA)

Explanation:

  • • Explanation:
  • • Fetal anemia in Rh-incompatible pregnancies is primarily assessed using Doppler ultrasound of the fetal middle cerebral artery (MCA) . The peak systolic velocity (PSV) of the MCA increases in response to anemia due to a brain-sparing effect , where blood flow is redistributed to essential organs like the brain.
  • • Doppler ultrasound of the fetal middle cerebral artery (MCA)
  • • brain-sparing effect
  • • When maternal anti-D titers are elevated , the fetus is monitored using MCA Doppler ultrasonography . If the MCA-PSV is >1.5 multiples of the median (MoM) for gestational age, this suggests moderate-to-severe fetal anemia . If significant anemia is suspected, cordocentesis (cord blood sampling) may be performed for direct measurement of fetal hemoglobin levels and possible intrauterine transfusion .
  • • When maternal anti-D titers are elevated , the fetus is monitored using MCA Doppler ultrasonography .
  • • anti-D titers are elevated
  • • MCA Doppler ultrasonography
  • • If the MCA-PSV is >1.5 multiples of the median (MoM) for gestational age, this suggests moderate-to-severe fetal anemia .
  • • MCA-PSV is >1.5 multiples of the median (MoM)
  • • moderate-to-severe fetal anemia
  • • If significant anemia is suspected, cordocentesis (cord blood sampling) may be performed for direct measurement of fetal hemoglobin levels and possible intrauterine transfusion .
  • • cordocentesis (cord blood sampling)
  • • intrauterine transfusion
  • • Other Options:
  • • Other Options:
  • • Option A. Cord blood sampling (Cordocentesis):
  • • Option A. Cord blood sampling (Cordocentesis):
  • • This is the gold standard for diagnosing fetal anemia but is an invasive procedure associated with risks like preterm labor and fetal loss. It is only performed when MCA Doppler findings suggest severe anemia .
  • • This is the gold standard for diagnosing fetal anemia but is an invasive procedure associated with risks like preterm labor and fetal loss. It is only performed when MCA Doppler findings suggest severe anemia .
  • • gold standard
  • • invasive
  • • MCA Doppler findings suggest severe anemia
  • • Option B. Chorionic villus sampling (CVS):
  • • Option B. Chorionic villus sampling (CVS):
  • • This is used primarily for chromosomal and genetic analysis in the first trimester . It has no role in detecting fetal anemia .
  • • This is used primarily for chromosomal and genetic analysis in the first trimester .
  • • chromosomal and genetic analysis
  • • first trimester
  • • It has no role in detecting fetal anemia .
  • • no role in detecting fetal anemia
  • • Option D. Umbilical artery Doppler:
  • • Option D. Umbilical artery Doppler:
  • • This is used in cases of intrauterine growth restriction (IUGR) to assess placental insufficiency . It is not useful for detecting fetal anemia .
  • • This is used in cases of intrauterine growth restriction (IUGR) to assess placental insufficiency .
  • • intrauterine growth restriction (IUGR)
  • • placental insufficiency
  • • It is not useful for detecting fetal anemia .
  • • not useful for detecting fetal anemia

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The peak systolic velocity of the fetal middle cerebral artery (MCA-PSV) is the most commonly used non-invasive method to assess fetal anemia in cases of Rh incompatibility . A value greater than 1.5 MoM indicates moderate-to-severe anemia , warranting further invasive testing like cordocentesis .
  • ➤ peak systolic velocity of the fetal middle cerebral artery (MCA-PSV)
  • ➤ non-invasive
  • ➤ fetal anemia
  • ➤ Rh incompatibility
  • ➤ 1.5 MoM
  • ➤ moderate-to-severe anemia
  • ➤ cordocentesis

questions.text: A 28-year-old woman presented to your hospital emergency with pregnancy 22 weeks, which was a result of rape. Correct statement regarding Medical Termination of Pregnancy is? (NEET PG 2024)

options.label: A
options.text: MTP can be done routinely after 24 weeks POG

options.label: B
options.text: MTP is permissible for 20-24 weeks POG in this case

options.label: C
options.text: MTP is permissible for 20-24 weeks POG in this case only if it threatens the life of the mother

options.label: D
options.text: MTP is permissible for 20-24 weeks POG in this case with 1 Doctor’s opinion only

questions.correct_answer: B. MTP is permissible for 20-24 weeks POG in this case
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) MTP is permissible for 20-24 weeks POG in this case

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ MTP between 20-24 weeks of pregnancy is considered high risk and requires two doctors' opinions, especially in cases of rape, incest, disability, or if the woman is a minor.

questions.text: A male present with grouped painful vesicular lesions in the genital area. History of multiple sexual partners present. Irregular use of condoms history present. Smear showed MNGCs. What is the diagnosis? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Herpes genitalis should be considered when a patient presents with grouped painful vesicular lesions in the genital area, especially when there is a history of risky sexual behavior and multinucleated giant cells are observed on a smear.

questions.text: Correct about trial of labor in a previous LSCS (Lower Segment Cesarean Section) is? (FMGE JULY 2024)

options.label: B
options.text: Emergency cesarean facility should be there

questions.correct_answer: B. Emergency cesarean facility should be there
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Emergency cesarean facility should be there

Explanation:

  • • Explanation:
  • • The correct answer is emergency cesarean facility should be there . When considering a trial of labor after cesarean (TOLAC), it is crucial to ensure that the facility is equipped to handle an emergency cesarean section. This is because the risk of complications, including uterine rupture, can pose significant risks to both the mother and the fetus.
  • • emergency cesarean facility should be there
  • • Emergency cesarean facility : The availability of an emergency cesarean section facility is essential for any patient undergoing TOLAC. This ensures that if complications arise, such as uterine rupture, immediate surgical intervention can be provided to minimize risks.
  • • Emergency cesarean facility
  • • Other Option:
  • • Other Option:
  • • Option A. Risk of uterine rupture is 4-9% : This statement is incorrect for a lower segment cesarean section. The risk of uterine rupture in a TOLAC for a lower segment cesarean section is much lower, around 0.2%. The 4-9% risk applies to upper segment or classical cesarean sections.
  • • Option A. Risk of uterine rupture is 4-9%
  • • Additional Considerations for TOLAC:
  • • Additional Considerations for TOLAC:
  • • Interval between pregnancies : The inter-delivery interval should be more than 18 months to allow adequate healing of the uterine scar. Reason for previous cesarean : Conditions like cephalopelvic disproportion (CPD) or other recurrent indications may reduce the likelihood of a successful TOLAC and increase the risk of complications. Monitoring : Continuous fetal monitoring during labor is recommended to detect any signs of fetal distress early.
  • • Interval between pregnancies : The inter-delivery interval should be more than 18 months to allow adequate healing of the uterine scar.
  • • Interval between pregnancies
  • • Reason for previous cesarean : Conditions like cephalopelvic disproportion (CPD) or other recurrent indications may reduce the likelihood of a successful TOLAC and increase the risk of complications.
  • • Reason for previous cesarean
  • • Monitoring : Continuous fetal monitoring during labor is recommended to detect any signs of fetal distress early.
  • • Monitoring

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ When attempting a trial of labor after cesarean (TOLAC) , ensure that an emergency cesarean facility is available to handle any complications, particularly the risk of uterine rupture.
  • ➤ trial of labor after cesarean (TOLAC)
  • ➤ emergency cesarean facility

questions.text: Kienbock disease is caused by avascular necrosis of which of the following bones? (NEET PG 2016)
questions.explanation:
Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Kienbock's disease specifically refers to avascular necrosis of the lunate bone, which is one of several named osteochondritis conditions affecting different bones throughout the body.

questions.text: A 52-year-old woman diagnosed with carcinoma cervix stage 2B was advised radiotherapy. Which of the following statements regarding radiotherapy is false? (NEET PG 2020)

options.label: A
options.text: Point B is 3 cm lateral to point A

options.label: B
options.text: Point A is 2 cm above the external os and 5 cm lateral to the internal uterine canal

options.label: C
options.text: Point A receives a dose of 7000 cGy

options.label: D
options.text: Point B receives a dose of 6000 cGy

questions.correct_answer: B. Point A is 2 cm above the external os and 5 cm lateral to the internal uterine canal
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Point A is 2 cm above the external os and 5 cm lateral to the internal uterine canal

Explanation:

  • • False Statement Explanation
  • • Point A is 2 cm above the external os and 5 cm lateral to the internal uterine canal : This statement is false because Point A is defined as 2 cm lateral and 2 cm superior to the external cervical os, not 5 cm lateral.
  • • Point A is 2 cm above the external os and 5 cm lateral to the internal uterine canal : This statement is false because Point A is defined as 2 cm lateral and 2 cm superior to the external cervical os, not 5 cm lateral.
  • • Point A is 2 cm above the external os and 5 cm lateral to the internal uterine canal
  • • This statement is false because Point A is defined as 2 cm lateral and 2 cm superior to the external cervical os, not 5 cm lateral.
  • • This statement is false because Point A is defined as 2 cm lateral and 2 cm superior to the external cervical os, not 5 cm lateral.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Point A in cervical cancer radiotherapy is located 2 cm lateral and 2 cm superior to the external cervical os, and the total dose should not exceed 8000 cGy.
  • ➤ Ref: Page no 350, DC Dutta’s Textbook of Gynecology 6 th edition
  • ➤ Ref: Page no 350, DC Dutta’s Textbook of Gynecology 6 th edition

questions.text: As per United Nations Sustainable Development Goals, Targets for MMR and U5MR to be achieved by 2030 are: (FMGE JULY 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) 70 MMR, 25 U5MR

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The United Nations Sustainable Development Goals aim to reduce the maternal mortality ratio to below 70 per 100,000 live births and the under-5 mortality rate to 25 per 1,000 live births by 2030.

questions.text: A 70-year-old male patient presents with decreased hearing in higher frequencies. It was noted that the basilar membrane was affected. Which of the following structures lie near the affected structure? (NEET PG 2022)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Oval window

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In cases of high-frequency hearing loss, the basal turn of the cochlea near the oval window is typically involved. Understanding the anatomical proximity of the oval window to the basal turn helps in pinpointing the site of lesion and aids in specific diagnostic and therapeutic approaches aimed at the high-frequency hearing spectrum.

questions.text: Choose the correct statement regarding the telomerase theory of aging? (NEET PG 2022)

options.label: A
options.text: Telomere stability is associated with aging

options.label: B
options.text: Abnormal telomerase activation is associated with aging

options.label: C
options.text: Decreased telomere length is associated with aging

options.label: D
options.text: Increased telomere length is associated with aging

questions.correct_answer: C. Decreased telomere length is associated with aging
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Decreased telomere length is associated with aging.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Decreased telomere length is associated with aging. Telomeres shorten with each cell division, leading to cell-cycle arrest or apoptosis when they become critically short, contributing to the aging process. Telomerase helps prevent this shortening but is typically inactive in most somatic cells, leading to aging and limited cell division capability.

questions.text: A 32-year-old male needs to be dressed in female lingerie and high heels to feel aroused and have intercourse with a female; he denies any sexual attraction towards males. What is the likely diagnosis? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Transvestic fetishism

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Transvestic fetishism is characterized by sexual arousal from cross-dressing in individuals who do not have discomfort with their gender identity.

questions.text: The farmer presents with a cauliflower-like mass on the foot, which developed after a minor injury, as depicted in the image. Microscopic examination reveals the presence of copper penny bodies. Based on this information, what is the most probable diagnosis? ( NEET PG 2022)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A. Chromoblastomycosis

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Chromoblastomycosis is identified by its clinical presentation of verrucous skin lesions and the histopathological finding of sclerotic or copper penny bodies, indicative of infection with dematiaceous fungi.
  • ➤ Chromoblastomycosis is identified by its clinical presentation of verrucous skin lesions and the histopathological finding of sclerotic or copper penny bodies, indicative of infection with dematiaceous fungi.
  • ➤ Chromoblastomycosis
  • ➤ clinical
  • ➤ verrucous skin
  • ➤ histopathological finding
  • ➤ sclerotic or copper penny
  • ➤ dematiaceous fungi.

questions.text: True about telomeres and telomerase is:(NEET PG 2022)

options.label: B
options.text: Gradually decreasing length of telomeres with ageing

options.label: D
options.text: Telomerase is found in somatic cells

questions.correct_answer: B. Gradually decreasing length of telomeres with ageing
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Gradually decreasing length of telomeres with ageing

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Telomeres are end of chromosomes and do not contain any coding sequences. Instead it has TTAGGG sequence repeated ‘n’ no. of times.
  • ➤ Telomerase is enzyme present only in the germ/stem cells and is responsible for maintaining the length of telomeres due to its RNA dependent DNA polymerase activity.
  • ➤ In Somatic cells, absence of telomerase enzyme (option d is false) results in telomere shortening as the cells ages .
  • ➤ .

References:

  • ↳ Reference : Harper’s 31 st ed/pg- 355, 716

questions.text: Identify the structures as marked in the image: (NEET PG 2024)

questions.text: Which of the following is the likely disease looking at the pattern of inheritance as provided in the image? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ X-linked recessive conditions are characterized by affected males and carrier females, as males have only one X chromosome, making them susceptible if the gene is defective.

questions.text: Identify the class of immunoglobulin shown in the image below. ( NEET PG 2020)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Ig A

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Secretory IgA is critical for mucosal immunity due to its unique structure and location. It acts as the first line of defence by preventing pathogens from adhering to and penetrating mucosal surfaces, thus playing a vital role in protecting the body from infections, especially at the mucosal barriers.

questions.text: Outlet forceps is applied at what station? (FMGE JULY 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Head on perineum

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Outlet forceps are applied when the fetal head is visible at the perineum, indicating it is at the outlet of the birth canal.

questions.text: Where is use of this instrument contra-indicated? (FMGE JAN 2025)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Obstructed labor

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Obstructed labor is an absolute contraindication for instrumental delivery (both forceps and vacuum) and is a direct indication for cesarean section.

questions.text: A 10-year-old male child came to the casualty with difficulty in walking and pain in the perianal region. On subjecting the specimen from the perianal region to a test, yellow needle-shaped crystals are seen under the microscope. What is the test done? ( NEET PG 2023)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Barberio’s Test

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Microchemical tests for Semen: Florence and Barberio test (Both are presumptive tests)
  • ➤ Microchemical tests for Semen:
  • ➤ Microchemical tests for Blood: Teichmann’s and Takayama test (Both are confirmatory tests)
  • ➤ Microchemical tests for Blood:
  • ➤ Non-cellular Semen Markers: Acid phosphatase test (quantitative), Prostate specific antigen or PSA (p30)
  • ➤ Non-cellular Semen Markers:
